    • Method Detail

      • withRequestedId

        public JobRequest.Builder withRequestedId(@Nullable
                                          java.lang.String requestedId)
        Set the id being requested for the job. Will be rejected if the ID is already used by another job. If not included a GUID will be supplied.
        Parameters:
        requestedId - The requested id. Max of 255 characters.
        Returns:
        The builder

      • withCommandArgs

        public JobRequest.Builder withCommandArgs(@Nullable
                                          java.util.List<java.lang.String> commandArgs)
        Set the ordered list of command line arguments to append to the command executable at runtime.
        Parameters:
        commandArgs - The arguments in the order they should be placed on the command line. Maximum of 10,000 characters per argument
        Returns:
        The builder

      • withTimeout

        public JobRequest.Builder withTimeout(@Nullable
                                      java.lang.Integer timeout)
        Set the timeout (in seconds) that the job should be killed after by the service after it has started.
        Parameters:
        timeout - The timeout. Must be greater greater than or equal to 1 but preferably much higher
        Returns:
        The builder

      • withDisableArchival

        public JobRequest.Builder withDisableArchival(boolean disableArchival)
        Set whether to disable log archive for the job.
        Parameters:
        disableArchival - true if you want to disable log archival
        Returns:
        The builder

      • withInteractive

        public JobRequest.Builder withInteractive(boolean interactive)
        Set whether the job should be treated as an interactive job or not.
        Parameters:
        interactive - true if the job is interactive
        Returns:
        The builder

        public JobRequest.Builder withResources(@Nullable
                                        ExecutionEnvironment resources)
        Set the execution resources for this job. e.g. setup file or configuration files etc
        Parameters:
        resources - The job resources to use
        Returns:
        The builder
